website_summaries.verdict: A solidly built inversion table with a couple of desirable features that are not found in other models.
pros: The weight limit on this model is 350 pounds
The thick memory foam backrest features a removable lumbar pillow for those who need extra support
If desired, you can purchase a model that features enhanced ankle supports for greater comfort
cons: Individuals with larger legs may feel the ankle cuffs are positioned a little too close together

customer_reviews.title: Safety Knob Does Not Fit Where It Should
customer_reviews.text: *** I will gladly remove this review and post a positive one if someone will contact me from customer service. I have contacted the place I bought it from using the email address and phone number provided in the manual, but no one will return my call, pick up the phone or return my email. There is no way to contact them to let them know that the knob included in the parts does not fit the whole where it goes to prevent the adjustable boom from falling out while you are upside down. This could cause an accident. Not sure what to do at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Imber

customer_reviews.title: 6 foot 7 and 370 lbs...this works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6XL hubby and he loves it! He's 6 foot 6, 370 lbs and this holds his weight and adjusts to his height no problem! You won't be sorry! I'm 5 foot 7 and 140. We both have back injuries from a car accident we were in 11 years ago. This really does help.
customer_reviews.author: YoMommaRhonda

customer_reviews.title: Potentially dangerous product
customer_reviews.text: Promising product but I had an accident with this table. When trying to return to an upright position, and return to upright, one side of the entire table collapsed off the pivot.
customer_reviews.author: Joe C.

customer_reviews.title: Please, do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty good sturdy but the problem is with the foot holding mechanism. It does not hold feet properly and my legs slip through, and I hang on my feet. It starts hurting my feet after 2+ min. I have not had the same with other inversion tables. I have to wear extra padding so it would not hurt my heels. You might as well try luck with any other. Update: I'm not able to use it anymore because the feet holding mechanism does not work properly. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Witley

customer_reviews.title: I keep receiving packages that look like they were previously opened and parts are missing
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't complete installation due to missing parts in the package. Thought maybe it was just a one-off lemon so returned and exchanged for another and the same thing happened... I keep receiving packages that look like they were previously opened and parts are missing. Complete waste of my time. Don't buy it. IRONMAN, step your game up!!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Hate this thing and now
customer_reviews.text: how does a person get it packaged back up to return it.. Totally impossible.. T bar to clamp distance is too long, hits on the calf instead of the ankle where it should be.. Clamp does not tighten enough for smaller legs, and I mean way too loose.. I wouldn't let my wife even try it.. leg clamps are very narrow.. better suited to small legs wheer the clamping span is just the opposite.. Very dissatisfied with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: outstanding quality in every way
customer_reviews.text: Wow - I'm impressed. This inversion table is gym or clinic level grade quality. Everything about the unit clearly shows careful thought and planning. The materials are top-notch, strong and precision made. The instructions are clear, full size, comprehensive and come with pre-packaged hardware even with installation tools (see photos - all a rarity in products from Amzn). The unit, once easily assembled, shows precision function, glides easily and is easily controlled by raising/lowering arms. The foot restraints are comfortable and firm. I wish all products would rise to this quality!!
customer_reviews.author: basement doc

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Missing all kinds of nuts and bolts!! What a mess!! Send back.
customer_reviews.author: M. Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Great table - bad strap hardware easily replaceable.
customer_reviews.text: Good: Great way to stretch out your back - helps with bad discs. It’s very heavy duty and easy to use. Assembly wasn’t too complicated. Bad: I took off one star for the following - The included snap rings for the limiting strap are straight garbage. I had one give way while I was inverted. It’s an easy fix though - go to your local big box store and purchase two 1/4” stainless steel quick links - these are rated for 1200 lbs. Next purchase a climbing carabiner. The fix should run about $15 total. Replace the snap rings with the quick link and on one side place the carabiner between the strap and the quick link.
customer_reviews.author: Soloban

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this inversion table for my husband and I. I have sciatica issues and he has a bad back. Let me tell you, best investment ever. I use this a few times a week for a few minutes at a time and it really helps with keeping my sciatica issues under control, my husband does the same thing for his back. This stretches your spine, we hang completely upside down from our ankles... just be careful if you have dogs, they love it when your upside down, they come over and lick your face and get you giggling, happens every time. LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: In love with my table!
customer_reviews.text: I stressed over which table to buy for months. Finally narrowed it down to 4 and this table won out. I couldn't be happier! It was easy to put together and seems to be very sturdy and well made. VERY easy to get in and out of. Ankle grips are very comfortable and the release bar is secure and easy to operate. I have only had the table for a couple of weeks but I have NO complaints! The memory foam padding is very comfortable and it is easy to operate all the way around. Highly recommend this table.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Flipped my World.
customer_reviews.text: NO DOUBT. This solely "stands" alone, as the most important item I've ever purchased. Easy assembly. Cost. Ease of adjustments. I promised myself, if this didn't help my back (one bulged disc. 4 degenerative disc's.) I would get the surgery, required. The relief was almost instant. Following the provide guideline for use, I progress in both time and angle. Twice a day, for 10 minutes. I weigh 330 lbs and have been losing 1-2 lbs weekly. Able to do more after work chores, do to feeling better after a long day. My sleep has been deeper and can feel my posture returning. IRONMAN has worked miracles on me and highly recommend it everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Doogerexpress

customer_reviews.title: Allmost eliminated our caropratice bills!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, love the ankle support design! Heavy duty square tube design so the frame don't end up compressing at the joints and end up wobbling down the road.My wife and I use it regularly to keep annoying back issues at bay. Prior we were going for adjustment up to four times a month, now once a year if that! We don't find it necessary to do more than couple minutes in the down position to get a noticeable change in our annoying back pressure and pain. Coupled with laying back on a ice pad keeps use in the daily game. Would and HAVE recommended this unit to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Orv Sankey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent investment. The table is sturdy and secure. Only once did I need a second pair of hands to help me in assembling the table. There are at least two points in the assembling process that were not clear and it took me a while to think it out. The reason that I gave the table four stars for pain relief instead of five is this: I have arthritis in my lower back. Unfortunately, the table does not cure this condition. Nonetheless, I do feel better as the day progresses. On the whole, the table is solid and reasonably priced. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John De Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Relive your back pain
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Ironman 4000 now for about a month now to help my back pain. I use it 2-3 time a day for a couple minutes each time to help relieve my constant discomfort from spinal stenosis. I've felt some improvement. Using the Ironman lets my vertebrae open a bit, taking some pressure off the discs. I'm hoping to regain some of the 2 inches in height I've lost over the years. Several years ago I paid over $2000 to the chiropractor to have me lie on his decompression table to stretch me out to relieve the pressure on my spine. This does the same thing for a lot less money.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lavorgna

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Has been a godsend for mine and my wife's back. Took a little getting use to getting the adjustments right so we were properly balanced. Easy to put together. It is not portable however, I thought it would fold up but it does not. You need to make sure you have a good space for it, because it will be there for awhile. I'm a big 6'3 300lb guy and it had no problem handling my weight. Easy to transition from my height to my wife's with a simple adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stride

customer_reviews.title: Look no further!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. My fiancé has a bad back because he’s a mechanic and bends over vehicles all day. He uses this once or twice a day for pain relief and it helps tremendously. It’s very sturdy and only took 15-20 min to put together. He is 6’5” and this product fits his stature for those who are worried because they’re taller and/or bigger. If you’re looking for a good inversion table. This is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Baehmer

customer_reviews.title: This is a very sturdy and comfortable inversion table
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy and comfortable inversion table. I have sciatica pain and disc compression and am using this instead of surgery. So far the pain has been reduced. Only been using it a week and will comment again after I can really say if it's working. This model is really sturdy, has smooth motion and I was able to put it together easily. It's not light, (approx 75 lb), so be prepared to get some help carrying the box in.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: This is not a "Cure All"
customer_reviews.text: Please read all the reviews and take them with "A GRAIN OF SALT". If you have back problems (compressed discs) and want to temporarily stretch out your spine to relieve pain, the concept is good. However, this is not for everyone. Each person is different and their backs react differently to the inversion table !!! Please talk with your doctor and/or Physical Therapy. I had to return the inversion table I got because after just a few "short" times in the third day........I got up the next morning and had so much much pain in my lower back and left leg, I could barely walk. Got better the next day. I am an older man in fair shape.
customer_reviews.author: James Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Adjusts easily.
customer_reviews.text: I have a slipped disk & have gone through injections, therapy & pain meds for well over two years. All offered temporary yet expensive relief. I was working out 5-6 days week before the injury. Since purchasing this table in Feb, I have used it twice a day. I am now back to working out & am pain free. I do take a herbal anti inflammatory daily as well. Was easy to assemble & love that it adjusts to different heights so easily. Great quality. Don't feel like it will fall apart while I'm upside down. Does not fold/store easily & is heavy. Put where you won't need to move it often.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Anders

customer_reviews.title: Total life changer!
customer_reviews.text: I have a bulging disc in my lower back plus sciatic nerve pain. Using this for 5 minutes two to three times a day has reduced my pain in just two weeks. I used to feel my disc slip in and out of place but now it feels solid. I am very active and this helps me to recover after a long walk or bike ride. Also, sitting for long periods of time can hurt my back, but this helps my disc stay in place. Total life changer!
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Easy ankle clamps and very sturdy construction
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty machine. Holds up to 350 lbs. Easy ankle clamps and very sturdy construction. The best I have seen. Be sure to have someone with you until you get used to it. I really like the adjustment for how tall you are. Easy to adjust and solidly built. It came in a box that looked like it was dropped out of an airplane, but it was the box outside the regular box, which was in good shape. Some people with bad backs have very good luck with this therapy. This is not a toy and should not be used as one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have bought it sooner!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for lower back pain and it has been worth every penny. I do not have experience with other inversion tables, but have been in the traction tables at chiropractors. To me this works even better and you are in the comfort of your own home. Assembly is fairly simple and it comes with decent tools to put together. Be aware it is extremely heavy in the box when it arrives and can be slightly tough for one person to put together. It does have adjustable height with suggestive settings. Depending on your body type you will have to play with this to get the balance right. When setting is correct you can effortlessly control the decline. Enjoy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but bad carabiner (hook) made me fall
customer_reviews.text: This works and does what it is supposed to, it is very sturdy. EXCEPT, for the carabiner (silver hook) that latches to a band to keep you from going all the way down. I was using it today and it broke, it sent me flying upside down. I am under the weight limit! It was not pleasant and has made my neck and ribs hurt. If this was fixed I would give it 5 stars! We have ordered screw on carabiners so this won't happen again! The ones it comes with are not made for this.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Just plain awesome
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box it was very easy to put together. I had it assembled in 20 minutes. It is very sturdy and does not rock or sway when using. I have no fear of it tipping or breaking apart on me. Used several times already. Very easy to adjust the angle. The locking feet (which resemble amusement park rides where it clicks into place as you move it down) is comfortable with or without shoes (have not tried without socks). With the padding, I do not feel it digging in at all.
customer_reviews.author: JavaDragon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for buck. My cousin has a Teeter, and while this lacks some of the refined finishing of a more expensive table, this is an industrial workhorse that gets the job done. It's a bit of an eye soar, but aren't they all? American made in Southern California - great quality. Assembly time: 45 mins. I bought this table because it folds up, but I haven't folded it once because it's constantly in use. I invert several times daily, sometimes for a few minutes, other times for twenty or thirty minutes. Amazing for your lower and mid back, as well as legs. Everything decompresses. I'm upset I didn't buy one earlier in life.
customer_reviews.author: Remington

customer_reviews.title: Very Solid, Great Table
customer_reviews.text: Really a great product. This is our second IRONMAN Gravity table (one for each of our two houses) and we couldn't be happier with the product. I just finished assembling the second table and it took about an hour. Everything fit together perfectly, all parts clearly marked, even included the two tools necessary for assembly. It's very heavy duty and feels solid when using it. I weigh 200 lbs and feel very comfortable on the table. My back feels much better after just 10 minutes of inverting. My wife loves it for stretching out her back as her chiropractor recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: I'm 38, 6'3" 190 lbs. I play full court basketball about 4 times a week and mix in some sand volleyball, so I stay active with high impact sports. As we know, the back/ core is the gateway to the body, so it needs to be cared for. My lower back spasms had become so severe, I couldn't sit on my couch. First day of use delivered major relief. After some research, I was surprised to learn the many benefits of inversion: improved mental clarity, detox, organ nourishment, etc. I don't often take the time for reviews, but this could change your life.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: There is no doubt this inversion table helped my lower ...
customer_reviews.text: There is no doubt this inversion table helped my lower back issues and sciatic nerve pain (I am 44 years old and have my issues arise from 38 years of regular golfing). The caveat with this table is that I tore an ACL and Menuscus snow skiing a few years ago, and after a few weeks of daily use there was obvious and accelerating aggravation of that knee. Luckily I was able to sell the table quickly on Craigslist. I have since ordered the Healthmark seated inversion chair to try out as that is supposed to isolate the knees instead of providing traction on the knees.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Einstein

customer_reviews.title: Straightened out my back in short order!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! You don't have to hang all the way upside down to get benefits! I set the table at about 20 to 30 degrees and it has straightened out my back problems in just a few sessions. It works GREAT! The only thing to watch out for is take your time setting the height adjustment. The initial setting (your height) just gives you a starting point to adjust the table. Be sure you can get back up before you hang to much. Have some help the first few times until you get it adjusted properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jim @ the spa

customer_reviews.title: I'm a former football player and present day firefighter and I would recommend this to anyone suffering from chronic lower back
customer_reviews.text: This table must only be rated #3 just because of the weight of the assembled table. This table hands down is number one in my opinion. I'm a former football player and present day firefighter and I would recommend this to anyone suffering from chronic lower back pain. I went from a constant 8 pain level experienced for 3 years to a 3 just after the initial 3 minutes at 40 degrees. It is easy to assemble and for me of larger stature is perfect and well built. The table's memory foam bed and secure ankle locking system is fantastic. I believe in paying things forward so here you go!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well-Made
customer_reviews.text: Good design, quality construction and excellent assembly instructions. Only three minor issues that can be easily corrected. 1) The right and left foot caps edges are sharp. They will scrape or score hardwood floors. 2) The nut caps do not fit snugly and are likely to fall off. 3) The lower safety hook attaches in a way that causes it to intermittently stick. it needs a grommet or retainer that prevents the smaller end of the hook from coming out of the support ring (picture attached)
customer_reviews.author: Bill Benton

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this inversion table for a couple years now. A couple minutes five or six times a week seems to help reset my back. The upside down pressure in my head doesn't bother me. I can feel a kind of suction pop from my back and take a minute or so to relax. Once I get up, the back feels better. When my back was at its worst, I found that a daily routine of yoga stretching was the best option to help my back pain. The table is another tool in the arsenal of helpful things.
customer_reviews.author: Shortimer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Ankle support does not fit small women or men !!! Scared me sent back !!!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great Table But A Few Improvement Are Needed
customer_reviews.text: I like the price and sturdiness Took about 30 minutes to assemble. Pros: Very Sturdy Comfortable Great Pricing Cons that prevented a 5 Star rating: Not a machine you can use in the bedroom and easily fold up and put against the wall. Very tall when folded. (see next) Said could be folded- I had to remove the table and at 85 lbs it's not easy to move as it has no wheels or rollers - I got this because of a bad back A Strap is used for positioning angle and is not easy to set. Some other tables come with simple preset locks at 20, 30 etc degrees
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Will hold your weight.
customer_reviews.text: I’m overweight. 6 foot 346 pounds (I set the height on the machine to 6’5 because of my weight). It holds me no problem. It was a little difficult to put together but not too bad I did it the night before Christmas about 4 hours to make sure that everything was right the instructions are great I just took my time. It works wonderful my back feels amazing. I had nerve problems from my lower back down to my foot and using this for just 2 days got rid of all that pain. Wonderful machine well worth it. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Great Inversion Table
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with the workmanship on this table. I did have a piece missing, call company, they immediately had it in the mail to me...no charge. One thing, but not a complaint. it would be nice if the table came back up from inversion with just bringing your arms back to your side having them over your head. but I am able to pull myself up with not problem. has great grab bars...very sturdy design and fabulous foot rests and locking bar/ nicely padded. I can use this table barefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Mo'

customer_reviews.title: I do like the high quality of this product at a very ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm no fitness guy; I chose this after my first experience with a chiropractor. I do like the high quality of this product at a very good price for what you get. Good fit and finish. Substantial weight feels secure, but--of course--is not easily portable. I'm 230lbs and it holds me just fine. It was easy to put together, too. And easy to get in and out of with a full feeling of security while doing your best bat imitation. I see no reason for anyone to pay double the price for that old guy's product--this does the job very well.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce N.

customer_reviews.title: Good product- Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money. Assembly was relatively easy, instructions are good, but the inluded tools were not good quality. Fortunately I have good tools of my own. You do need two people to place the table on the frame. Works well, feels very solid and is helping my back. I am a very big guy so I needed the strongest product I could find. This table easily supports me and feels rock solid. Even with the frame folded it still occupies lots of space so keep that in mind. It is heavy because it is well built, but this makes it a bit hard to move for one person.
customer_reviews.author: resomaniac

customer_reviews.title: Good to have around the house!
customer_reviews.text: My husband set this up (it was pretty easy to do) and we each tried it. While my husband was stretching his back, the hook that holds the table in place broke. He contacted the company but email (as was stated on the paperwork). They sent back a cryptic email and my husband went to Ace Hardware and purchased some chain to replace the broken part. We both use this machine and really like it. Don't have much good to say about the company though (Paradigm Health and Wellness).
customer_reviews.author: Kay Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Ironman gravity  Inversion table
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived fast and in safe packaging. Delivery man W’s nice enough to find out where I wanted it and placed it in our garage. Hubby put it together very fast with good Instructions. There was a broken piece of plastic but I wrote right away and the company sent out a replacement part. It takes some getting used to and you don’t go vertical right away. You work up to it. The equipment seems very sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: tutucat

customer_reviews.title: Total BLISS
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I have tried stretching, chiropractors, exercises, and rolling my back. NOTHING worked as well as this. From the 1st time I got on this my back felt better and now that I do this twice a day, my back is pain free! I recommend this to anyone who, like me, has to sit in a car all day for work, or wear heavy utility belts or for whatever other reason, has back pain. This is an amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: GreasyLittleDog

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Unit pretty much mirrored other reviews previously written. It was actually easier to assemble than anticipated. I dislike home assembly but was able to accomplish this with my wife in the lead, in less than an hour. It is versatile in terms of accommodating different heights of users and weights as well. I particularly like the folding feature as it is a large unit when fully assembled. I am happy with purchase. PS, there was a tear in the corrugated packaging as received, but it did not affect the assembly or spare parts kit.
customer_reviews.author: David Zerfoss

customer_reviews.title: I do it every time
customer_reviews.text: You decide you need pain relief, do research, find the right product at the right price, assemble it, and then it sits in a room. I do it every time. The product is fine, it's the user who needs replacement. LOL!
customer_reviews.author: James R. Townsend

customer_reviews.title: I began to use it for my scoliosis and it had amazing results. After going to a chiropractor for nearly ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband after back surgery for a ruptured disc on his 4-5 and S1. I began to use it for my scoliosis and it had amazing results. After going to a chiropractor for nearly 10 years I was able to get relief. So much relief that I haven't seen a chiropractor in over 2 years. I've save copayments of $40 ever 2-4 weeks so it paid for itself after 2 months. It's given relief to our friends and family as well. I can't recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: AnnE

customer_reviews.title: decent machine, but poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy machine, that is, fairly heavy. I think that is why the flimsy packaging was damaged when it was delivered (so I took off a star). Aside from that, it went together fairly easily and it does not take much effort to rotate. The handles definitely help the process.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Brown

customer_reviews.title: High quality and design, robust and compact inversion table
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was very straight forward, a second person is helpful as it’s easier to raise some heavy parts. Heaviness means sturdiness, and in this item that’s good. This is a middle-of-the-road model, but functionality and quality is top notch. It may be missing a few fancy moving add-ons, but works really nicely. I’m in my ~220 Lb and 6’2” and it hasn’t screamed yet. I’ve had it for a few months and it’s a real relief on my lower back, although... not 100%. But as a friend of mine once said, “it is not the arrow, it’s the indian!”
customer_reviews.author: Hector A. Tamburini

customer_reviews.title: This is VERY rugged unit of excellent design. While the unit could use much better ...
customer_reviews.text: This is VERY rugged unit of excellent design. While the unit could use much better instructions on its use, once I figured out all of the adjustments, the unit works perfect... and, within a week, completely eliminated my routine lower back aches! I did find that I had to set the height adjustment to "11 inches (I am 5"9" and 150 lbs) to get the balance correct. I am VERY satisfied. John Cleary.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN CLEARY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if your big, great tool to augment healing and recovery.
customer_reviews.text: Have L5/S1 and L3 disc issues. Using this 2-3 times a day for stretching has dramatically decreased my pain and time of recovery for procedures. I'm a big guy, 6'3", 280 and this bench is SOLID. I never feel unsafe on it. Folds up easily for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Y

customer_reviews.title: Stinker!
customer_reviews.text: This inversion table seems to work as designed. Construction is solid. Final assembly instruction with picture can be confusing. Takes some doping out to get table to frame connection right. The smell of the rubber ankle pads and frame footing is horrendous. If you set up in a small room the smell will make you nauseous. I've had this set up for a week now and it still stinks. Advise purchasers to put the rubber parts outside for a couple of weeks before you try to assemble and use this product.
customer_reviews.author: A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Not an instant fix
customer_reviews.text: If you think this thing will replace your chiropractor.....it wont. However, if you use it on a regular basis it will help. I use my just about everyday and have noticed a huge reduction in my lower back pain. Still have to go to the doc when I through my back out, usually by doing something stupid, but this does help keep me pain free.
customer_reviews.author: LadyB

customer_reviews.title: Instant relief
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'4" 235 pounds. This thing is sturdy. I suffer from lower back issues. I use it for maintenance and pain relief. Crazy thing is if I've over done it I can use this to get things back in place. Every time with pain I'll hang for a few minutes and then feel a pop and instant relief. Amazing piece for anyone that deals with back pain, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Leo

customer_reviews.title: Great for your back!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. It has helped my back tremendously and it feels amazing! It was the best $200 I have spent. My husband put it together in about 30 minutes. My only complaint was that it had a funny smell for the first week or so but it is gone now. I read all the reviews and this one got great ratings...I read those reviews and I am glad I did, great quality, sturdy and safe!! Update: Still loving this Ironman..my back loves it too. I have turned several people on to it because I work with a bunch of nurses and we are on our feel a great deal and once we are home, this gives us relief. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nursebetty911

customer_reviews.title: Had chronic lower back pain (bulging disc) for over 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: Had chronic lower back pain (bulging disc) for over 6 years - did everything: physical therapy, chiropractor, accupuncture, massage, stretching, yoga........ Nothing helped! Finally bought this inversion table. It changed my life completely. After consistently using it few times daily for about 2-3 weeks, pain disappeared. Yes, pain is gone! I'm no longer afraid to go for a 10-mile run because I know once I get on the inversion table, I will be relieved from any pressure that I might feel in my lower back and joints. I CANNOT live without it.
customer_reviews.author: Verbena

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help with back pain from herniated discs. When used by following the guidelines sent in the instructions, it has been helpful in alleviating my back pain. I don’t think it is a permanent fix, but I was not expecting it to be that. Two 10 minute sessions a day has done wonders, and my back is noticeably worse when I miss them. Assembly was easy just following the included instructions and it is very solid. The padding is comfortable, have never felt like I sank all the way through to the board. If you are in the market for an inversion table I’d highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: K. Ward

customer_reviews.title: My back felt wonderful though. Now I'm 62 and needed something to ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to use inversion boots about 25 or so and hanging completely upside down put too much strain on the rest of my body so I stopped. My back felt wonderful though. Now I'm 62 and needed something to decompress and this is it. I'm 6'5 and 250+ lbs. and this table is incredibly sturdy and well worth $199. Didn't take long to put together and I've used every day for 10 days and feel great. If your looking for an inversion table this won't disappoint you.
customer_reviews.author: Tom U.

customer_reviews.title: Correction to my last review
customer_reviews.text: Product is legit and works great, very sturdy you wont believe its only 200 bucks. I'm 6'1 230 pounds and works great. I previously wrote a review about missing bolts, that was incorrect. I read the instructions wrong and was high on pain medication for my back. That's the excuse I'm using anyhow. Everything was correct and very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with this!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift to my husband last year and we spent close to a year using it before writing this. I instantly feel the relief from my legs and back when using this. Feels very secure and well-made. I also had a bad episode of dizziness that persisted for about two weeks. I decided to try this to see if it would provide any relief. I am not lying when I say, after one use for several minutes, my dizziness was gone. This keeps me away from massages and the chiropractor to relieve symptoms. At this time I am pregnant, but this is one thing I really miss from my pre-pregnancy days!!
customer_reviews.author: Erica W.

customer_reviews.title: Padding on the backrest.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Table was easy to assemble. All the parts were there. Instructions was easy to follow also. The only flaw I seen, and I saw it immediately as soon as I put the table together was the padding on the table. I notice black staples on the floor and immediately noticed that they were falling from the edge of the padding. Apparently they stapled the edge of the padding to the backrest. And it was cheaply done. For right now its holding. It should have been embroidered. That's why I'm giving it four stars instead of five. The ankle holders work great. I'm 185lbs and they hold very well. Other then the staples falling out the table works great.
customer_reviews.author: viper1

customer_reviews.title: Good Build Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Well built, sturdy components. Adjustment of inversion angle is quick and easy. Comfortable compared to other inversion table I have tried. I am a pretty tall guy at 6'1". At no point during use have I ever felt unsafe. The stand provides a wide, stable base. Pros: Price compared to competitor products Build quality Relative comfortable during use Relatively easy height and angle of inclination adjustment Cons: Takes up a lot of space, even in the collapsed position Heavy Assembly is tedious, but not complicated
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great inversion table for fat people
customer_reviews.text: I bought this table after falling victim to a herniated disc, I was weary at first because I'm actually a little heavier then the 350lb limit. I've been using it for about 2 weeks now and although my herniated disc still hurts, the rest of my back feels amazing, hardest part of using it is locking your feet in tightly due to the short locking lever, but once you are locked in, it feels really secure. I put it together in about 20 minutes, hardest part of that was bending over, very simple to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good price a little large.
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out how to set it so I can get up easily and the tricky way to unlock your feet when you're done it does the job. Better price than expensive models. Works just as well, maybe more comfortable and solid. However, I do not enjoy how much space it takes up. I have a small home. I have to use this in the middle of my guest bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Davis

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, effective, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I read a ton of reviews before buying this, learning that cheaper models can be dangerous if you slip out of the ankle holders or if the device collapses. I am 5'10", 170 pounds, and this is sturdy enough that I haven't experienced or worried about the product failing. My chiropractor recommended inversion at 45 degrees which was easy to set using my cellphone as a spirit level. I feel that my lower back has improved with regular use of this table.
customer_reviews.author: Donald N. Janes Jr.

customer_reviews.title: This looks like it was done before delivery as the back had ...
customer_reviews.text: Missing side plates. This looks like it was done before delivery as the back had a tear long enough to get some parts out from fedex again and the side panels number 37 were missing. This is a waste of time and money to have to find new ones or send it back. ——- Ok the box was torn but there r no side plates they r covers and were in the box. My mistake but fixing it now. This is excellent quality works as expected for 5 ft to 6-5 friends. So for price excellent product quality and it works perfectly. 5 stars now. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Funnyboy

customer_reviews.title: Received with 10 parts missing. RETURNED ITEM. Package ...
customer_reviews.text: Received with 10 parts missing. RETURNED ITEM. Package arrived inside a bigger box. The top of the original box was gone. It had no paper work. A co-worker of my wife had just bought this same item so she borrowed her paperwork to find out there was 10 items missing.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Ray Hare

customer_reviews.title: First inversion table purchase
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I got this primarily for her lower back problems but I use it occasionally as well. This thing is amazing! It is our first inversion table and we could not be more happy with it. Easy to adjust heights as she is 5’8” and I am 6’ 1”. My wife assembled this by herself while I was at work and it is very sturdy and easy to put together. The only issue we have with it is that it is difficult to store/put away and it is too heavy for my wife to move around by herself and she isn’t weak.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great investment for me!
customer_reviews.text: At 6'6" and 235 lbs., this unit is comfortable, stable, and safe. I have been using it for 5 mins. at a 45°, twice a day, and it has greatly relieved my chronic lower back pain. That being said, this may make some conditions worse, so ease into this! Start with a couple of minutes at a slight angle, and go from there if you are able to.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Wood

customer_reviews.title: A rare 5 star review from me.
customer_reviews.text: Very rarely do I leave a 5 star review, but this product gets one. Normally when I spend more than $100 I expect a very good product, and I'm very particular. This one met up to my standards. The rubber feet are heavy duty, the frame, the table...Everything seems like it will last a long time. Very happy with this purchase! As far as using it, be prepared for it to be painful this first few days. When your spine first starts stretching it will not feel good, but don't quite. For me it took 4 days and then my back finally released. I feel so much better and have much more flexibility! Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Back pain relief!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this table and assembled it yesterday (quite easy to do yourself). I've used it 3 times since then for short durations and have already felt significant improvements in my back. I have moderate issues with scoliosis and back pain, and through my work I sit for much of the day causing compression in my spine. I plan on using this daily for pain relief and overall care. If you're considering purchasing an inversion table for any similar issues, do it! Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal results
customer_reviews.text: If your suffering from and joint pain, especially lumbar (back) this product is wonderful. Assembly was very easy (30 minutes) and unlike most products requiring assembly, all the pieces were there. Follow the instructions on how to use it because if you body is not accustomed to be upside down, it could be counter productive. After using it for four or more weeks, I have seen a dramatic difference in reducing the pain in my lower back. You could spend 3x this amount going to physical therapy that yield little results, especially for lower back pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the back..
customer_reviews.text: Love it. At 6'3" and 240, I was concerned about it being ok for my height but I fit with room to spare. I do suggest you set the foot-pegs about 2" taller than you actually are, as once you rotate backwards you tend to slide up a bit and you'll be out of balance. I set mine at 6'5" and the balance is perfect. Very sturdy and folds up nicely when you want to store it against the wall. Hanging upside down and doing sit ups is great work, and I find it helps get those last few kinks/pops out of my back.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L Kane

customer_reviews.title: Well built and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Use on short term only. Inversion for long periods cause one of my co-workers to experience dizzyness. Something to do with the inner ear. Not sure since I just invert and flip right back up. Pops everything. I use 3 pound weights to exercise when I am inverted. I leave it set up and whenever I go past it I take a spin and keep my vertebra aligned. Well built and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis A. Buckmeir

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.text: Parts missing. Called their number and impossible to speak with a person. The recording says leave a message and it hangs up on you. I would give them zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Would rate 5 if not for some minor issues
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and heavy duty, doesnt fold up as easily as what i used to have, but still can be stored easily enough in a decent sized closet (just pull out the part for the feet first). Im confident it can hold up to its listed maximum weight. 2 Issues: 1 - missing screw lock knob (part 30) for height adjustment, but not major issue as thats more for rattle than anything else. 2 - had to bend out guide posts for one of the lever arms so it could slide into place, might be disconcerning for the more squimish but its not a load bareing location that had to be bent.
customer_reviews.author: zander Goodahl

customer_reviews.title: Back feels much better
customer_reviews.text: Only use this for a short period of time < 90 seconds, and don't use it after you work-out or you might feel the head rush. My wife used this as she had back issues, and within about 3-4 uses her back was feeling much better. I've used it a few times and it works well. For the $$$ vs. a Chiropractor this works quite well. Being inverted just relaxes you and it's quite an experience. I have to admit though that we haven't used this much over the last few months, but will probably use it more consistently to alleviate minor back aches, or if we just want to get the zen flowing.
customer_reviews.author: D. Holland

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought another inversion table on Amazon, for about $115. The old saying that you get what you pay for turned out to be true - it was a piece of junk. I have since left a one star rating. After I returned it, I bought the Iron Man inversion table. Built like a tank! Oh, and this therapy really works. My lower back feels better than it has in a long time. You won't be disappointed in this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy with hand holds to get on
customer_reviews.text: This inversion table is so much easier to get on than my old one. I was no longer able to get onto the old one. This one has hand holds and is sturdy enough to brace me. I need it to strengthen the muscles in my neck and back. It is helping the whiplash injured muscles wonderfully, but is much slower strengthening my lower back. Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Bell

customer_reviews.title: This is the Best Inversion Table!
customer_reviews.text: About this for my husband and his chronic lower back pain. The IronMan gravity 4000 is very well-made and sturdy. My husband weighs 300 pounds and feels very comfortable using this. The ankle locking system it's nice around your ankles in the memory foam in the extra wide frame is a plus. The lumbar pillow is removable and adjustable. It was easy to assemble, and use by yourself. This is the second one who thought we had to move and couldn't take the first one with us. I would highly recommend this with anyone with back pain.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gekle

customer_reviews.title: Might just replace your Chiropractor!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing inversion table, very easy to assemble, directions were perfectly detailed, extremely sturdy and is so easy to set up for perfect traction. I have only been on it a few times and I am already feeling great relief from my severe back pain. This is my backs new best friend! I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: rush2112guy

customer_reviews.title: Really well built and simple assembly!
customer_reviews.text: First off, I was really impressed with how simple the assembly was. The instructions were easy to follow and the hardware was even labeled with the step that it was used in. Ok, so I’ve only used this a couple times so far but it felt great. It took a little time to get used to hanging inverted but once I relaxed my muscles it felt great. I sit down most of the day at work and I think that this will be great to help stretch me out. I don’t have back pain per day, but my back does get stiff from the constant sitting. I’m glad I made the purchase and wish I had done it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hart

customer_reviews.title: Misrepresented Weight In Amazon Description
customer_reviews.text: Amazon states this unit weighs "7.56" pounds. It actually weighs 75 lbs. It is well designed and very stable. I'd like to see it made lighter. Aluminum would make it more expensive, I get that, but a spindly old person will not have an easy time moving this out of their way. Or they just won't be able to move it.
customer_reviews.author: ZX9RMike

customer_reviews.title: Hubby is happy... feels like good stretch to his back.
customer_reviews.text: My husband's doctor recommended this one and he's happy with it. He uses it a couple times a week and seems to think it helps stretch out his back and help with his posture. It was pretty easy for us to assembly by ourselves and very easy to use. Seems very durable and will last a LONG time.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas mom & crafter

customer_reviews.title: Designed and built for Big Boys. Not a toy.
customer_reviews.text: AFTER USING THIS PRODUCT FOR A WEEK, I AM ABLE TO WALK TO THE GROCERY STORE. I AM 250lb AND 6'3". IT IS STABLE WITH ME IN IT. PAIN ALMOST GONE. THANK YOU. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do you really need this?
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived damaged. but the company did provide a replacement piece for me without additional cost. However, my wife (which requested the device) used it twice then decided it wasn't comfortable to hang upside down. Suprise suprise. I guess this is about a comfortable as you can get upspide down, but I would strongly suggest you consider the benefit to discomfort advantage/disadvantage.
customer_reviews.author: John R Nott

customer_reviews.title: This product is the best! If you have back pain, buy this machine!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is the best machine I have ever invested in. I had two herniated bulging discs in my back, the doctor's prognosis was surgery. I took a chance and used the inversion table and within a week I felt completely healed. I thank God himself for this product and highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: linden orr

customer_reviews.title: Tall-People Friendly
customer_reviews.text: It works well for it's intended purpose. I'm a 6'4 220lb+ male and this worked well for me. I ended up no longer having back pains in part to using this and re-sold it to someone who was in a car accident many years ago and was still suffering back-pain. I wished them great luck in it helping them as it helped me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ironman is the best. I love this thing. I almost bought a more expensive better known brand. I decided on the ironman it's so comfortable to use. It took some time to figure out how to adjust it. I'm a 5'2" female, I adjusted it to 5"9". With barley any arm movement, I can decline and incline with complete ease. Also, its nice quality. I think it'll last forever. Buy and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this inversion table. The instant I inverted for the first time my back popped in multiple places and the relief was great. These tables aren’t long term fixes, but used daily they can provide relief. This is an excellent inversion table, especially for the money.
customer_reviews.author: BigSteve77

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Package of parts was a screw short. Emailed mfgr who quickly sent an entire parts package. As I recall some other reviewer said to set the height about an inch or so longer than your actual height. This will insure that your head rests fully on the bed. The tilt adjusting strap works OK, but it's a hassle to fiddle with it for users of different heights such as my wife and me. It would be nice if the tilt could be adjusted with a setting knob or some such.
customer_reviews.author: FmrAFpilot

customer_reviews.title: Best medicine for a bad back.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy I chose this model. I'm 6' 3" and this model is very easy to use and sturdy. I had a cheaper model before this and it would not adjust as easily and would wobble during use. The side handles are very helpful in returning to the upright position. I have been using an inversion table for over 6 months and have notice most of my joint pains have reduced in severity or completely disappeared. Allowing my spine to slowly heal itself through inversion is the best medicine I have been able to find for my back issues, which are pretty much non existent at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K Birkhead

customer_reviews.title: 2 YEARS LATER - AWESOME!!!!! PADDED BED, VERY HEAVY DUTY
customer_reviews.text: It has been over 2 years now, and I felt compelled to write. Since purchasing, I have had two other friends buy it, and they love it as much as I do. I am 62, have cervical fusion and lumbar pinched nerves, and WOW this helps so so much. It will take you a few times to really relax on it, but once you get used to it, you will want to use it more and more.. I have it in the bedroom so as soon as I wake up I get in it and it really opens your spine to get the fluids moving. Save money on doctor visits, this thing is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: An okay product
customer_reviews.text: My husband is 6 Foot and weights over 200 LBS. Very sturdy equipment and easy to assemble. The cushion is just right, along with the feet cuffs. Does give some relief, just not the full amount like my husband was looking for. Definitely takes some getting use to, but after a few times you will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Charleen Gemberling

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with ironman 4000
customer_reviews.text: My inversion table arrived on time and it fit together fine. I gradually increased the angle to about 60 degrees and for 5 minutes. For me, I am able to return to the upright position by increasing the height an inch. I might try to increase it 1 more inch and see how that works. I'm happy with my purchase. The A frame is very stable with feet which are at the very edge of the base. I saw a different table which folded to a much smaller size but the feet were not positioned to the very edge of the base. I was not convinced it was stable as the ironman.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well made, fun
customer_reviews.text: It is solid. Heavy and well made. Easy to use. Instructions a bit difficult for someone who knows how to read words. However the things that stick out that are supposed to govern how far the table inverts do nothing. No matter what hole I use it inverts to 180 degrees (I think that's all the way). I have to rely 100 percent on the belt. Additionally, while the ankle clamps work great and seem to hold me upside down without a fear of falling on my head, they are curved to to fit around the ankle but they are too small for my ankles. They still hold me. Anyway, I'm enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Graziano

customer_reviews.title: ... MRI that all four of the lumbar discs are bad. I have had a long history of low ...
customer_reviews.text: recently had to have a steroid injection for a bulging disc between L3 and L4 and discovered through MRI that all four of the lumbar discs are bad. I have had a long history of low back pain and inversion therapy has my back in the best shape it been in decades! This table is very well built and the mechanism for holding the ankles is comfortable and secure. pad is solid although some type of vinyl it seems durable and the stiching is solid;
customer_reviews.author: gary dire

customer_reviews.title: Inversion!!!
customer_reviews.text: Inversion combined with exercise has been the best way I have found to keep away chronic pain from two herniated discs in my lower back. So, I would give five stars to any inversion machine but, this one in particular is really sturdy and well built.
customer_reviews.author: Damien d.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for spinal decompression
customer_reviews.text: I rebroke my back assembling this unit- but upon its use, it immediately helped my pain. If you need to decompress your spine, this unit is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: After we bought this item our doctor told us not ...
customer_reviews.text: After we bought this item our doctor told us not to stay inverted for more than 2 min. He explained that blood rushes to your head putting pressure on the optic nerve and has caused blindness in some people. I wish I'd known that before the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: We got this and I have a horrible back and pretty much hunch constantly and when we used this first time I didn't really feel anything happening, then I stood up. That's it, I stood straight up which was weird as I don't naturally stand straight up. It was a new sensation for me. The straight back didn't last long but I imagine prolonged use will do the trick! It felt so good to not have pressure on my back though. Nearly fell backwards after first use after almost blacking out from the rush of the blood so I recommend having someone with you until u get use to it. Definitely does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Long John Copper

customer_reviews.title: Great Inversion Table for a Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Very robust and effective at what it's meant to do. I have scoliosis and traction helps immensely along with chiropractic treatment. Easy enough to put together but, I would suggest using your own tools, as the tools provided are not the best quality. No need to spend more (2x-3x as much!) on other brands. This gets the job done, and will last for years due to its solid construction and good materials. I'm a pretty big guy too (250 lbs), and I have no anxiety about this product's ability to handle my weight.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon P.

product_meta.title: IRONMAN Gravity Highest Weight Capacity Inversion Table with Optional No Pinch AIRSOFT Ankle Holder
feature_bullets: Sturdy inversion table that may help reducing back stress and stimulating circulation
Removable lumbar pillow provides extra comfort for lower back support while inverting
Tough rubber non-skid floor stabilizers. Inverts up to 90 degrees; It has a 2.5 inch thick Memory-Foam vinyl covered backrest to provide superior comfort
Assembled Dimensions: 49"L x 26"W x 65"H | Folded Dimensions: 80"H x 26"W x 17"D
Weight Capacity - Supports up to 350 pounds
Ergonomically molded ankle cushions. Folds for storage

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
